Forum Post: 
Post title: Only first module attempt being recorded
Post description: Hi folks, I'm having some issues with moodle 2.6.2+. I upgraded from 2.6.2 yesterday, on which everything was running fine, in terms of launching and tracking module attempts. However, since upgrading, only the first attempt is being tracked. You can launch and attempt the module as many times as you like, but it will only record that first attempt score. In the module settings, there is no restriction on the number of attempts that can be made, there are no restrictions in place that lock the module off once it has been completed (whether they pass or fail the module on their first attempt, it doesn't record anything after) and there are no restrictions in the SCORM package itself (created using Articulate Storyline). I followed the upgrade instructions on the moodle site word for word and as i said, everything else seems to look and function as it did when running 2.6.2, its just the attempt recording that doesn't. Im testing this in chrome, and i'm not sure if it will help at all, but i used a web debugging proxy tool to monitor the traffic going out and have attached a couple of images (in the attached zip) that show the output of a successful attempt and an unsuccessful attempt (both from datamodel.php). EDIT: In addition to the above, every now and then, when relaunching a module (selecting 'Start new attempt' or not) I get an 'Unable to acquire LMS API' error (image and error log in zip attached). Not sure if these are related. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance, Andy

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle not adding cumulative scores with SCORM package
Post description: Hello, Our Server Environment and other information: The version of Moodle running  is Moodle 1.5.3, it is running on Windows 2003 IIS 6, running php 4.3.11. In order to make SCORM courses run on IIS, the isapirewrite program was used ( available here http://www.isapirewrite.com/download/isapi_rwl_0056.msi < http://www.isapirewrite.com/download/isapi_rwl_0056.msi >  ) The neccesary configuration for isapirewrite is contained in its 'httpd.ini' file. The line below was added to this file: RewriteRule (.*?\.php)(\/.+) $1\?file=$2 [N,I]. So, we have Moodle 'up and running' and working fine generally. Problem with a third-party package we received: Courseware includes a test (already tested and compliant within a proprietary CLIX environment) I set it up in Moodle and set the grading method to: 'Set to Scoes Situation'. (Have also tested it with 'Highest Grade' and 'Average Grade'. Same result as described below). Upon selecting the zipped scorm-compliant package for this SCORM Module, I get an error-message dialog Box: 'WARNING: The Tracking Data of this Package will be lost!' When I do the course, it works fine - if I do all of the test in one sitting . However, if I exit the course and go back in to complete anther section , Moodle does not retain/aggregate my score from the previous visit(s). Begins again at zero every time I re-enter. So, does not add cumulative scores/not aggregating properly. Can anyone suggest a fix for this? Do I need to post the mainfest file? Thank you, Colmán

Forum Post: 
Post title: Creating a new Activity type based on the SCORM Activity
Post description: All: I have a rather unique issue that's painted me into a corner, and I'm not sure if the solution I have in mind is even possible, which is why I'm asking you all. I have several courses that have a great many SCORM activities in them - some of them very large activities at that. These courses are built upon existing documentation that our customer wants us to mirror in an interactive way, so we don't have much flexibility when it comes to the contents of the course, unfortunately. Because of this, the increasing file sizes of our SCORM lessons (built in Captivate) as they're fleshed out and completed have led to our courses' becoming bloated and large to the point where we can no longer create course backup files and/or restore from them. Changing the max_upload_size and max_file_size in php settings isn't enough. We've hit some kind of threshold that is limiting us from performing backups on our courses, and I've thus far been unable to determine the cause. ( Moodle in English: What is the max allowable size for course backups? ) That being said, I've been told to find a workaround. I'm wondering if it would be possible for me to find a way to create a new type of activity which, instead of containing the SCORM package within the activity, links to it in the file system instead, and unpacks it in real time. A predecessor of mine created a new activity type that allowed us to treat Unity executables as SCORM lessons by wrapping them in a sort of dummy SCORM package that allowed us to link to the executable and run it locally on the student machine, through clever use of registry keys and database manipulation. However, that was before my time, and I'm not quite sure how they did it. Do any of you know how to create a new activity type, based on an existing one? I'd feel better if I at least knew which part of the moodle code I should be looking at, and maybe any sort of pitfalls I should look out for. I want it to receive grades as the regular SCORM activity does too, which is another difficulty, I think.

I've reviewed the info here: Direct Linking to the SCORM Package and Students not "skipping content structure page" but neither seems to address guest access.

Post title: Long loading of articulate content
Post description: Some students are unable to view my Moodle content (by Articulate) properly. They've got white screen instead of content progress bar. Progress bar appears only after 1,5-2 minutes instead of usual few seconds. Some of them have got high internet speed (30+ Mb/s by speedtest.net). The same content created for web delivery (not for LMS) doesn't create any problems. Articulate support offered solution. But there's no reason to publish content if a lot of students have to execute seven points below. What can I did wrong? Are they able to view other Moodle content quickly? Are you able to replicate the issue on your computer if you login as a regular user? If the issue is specific to your users' computers only, I would recommend forwarding them the steps below: 1) Upgrade Adobe Flash Player here: http://www.adobe.com/go/getflash 2) If your LMS requires Java to be installed on the client computers, be sure the correct version of Java is installed and enabled for your browser. Java can be downloaded and installed here: http://java.com 3) Clear your browser cache. You can do this in Internet Explorer by going to Tools > Internet Options > General > Temporary Internet Files. Select Delete Cookies and Delete Files. 4) Also in Internet Options, on the Security, Privacy, and Advanced tabs, reset everything to its default settings. There is a button on each tab to reset defaults. 5) In Windows Vista / 7, go to Start > All Programs > Accessories > Run. In Windows XP, go to Start > Run. 6) Copy / paste the following line of text (depending on your operating system) into the Run dialog box. Click OK, and delete the entire contents of the window (folder) that opens. Windows Vista / 7:"C:\Users\%username%\AppData\Roaming\Macromedia\Flash Player\#SharedObjects"

Post title: Captivate 4, SCORM, Firefox reporting quiz grades as 0.
Post description: So here's my problem. We have a series of SCORM 1.2 packages created in Captivate 4. Each one has some kind of video, text, or audio in the beginning and usually ends with a quiz. We are using moodle 1.9.5. We upload the zipped SCORM using moodle into a course. When we try to test the SCORM activity in Firefox , the activity reports a 0 to the gradebook. No matter what we score in the quiz, it's always a zero. For the longest time, we thought that the grades weren't reporting at all, but I recently discovered that the problem is only in Firefox. When we tested the SCORM in Safari, the test reported the correct score to the grade book. I then checked that score in a Firefox window. Sure enough, the grade for the activity was updated with the correct score. When I took the quiz again in Firefox, the score was overwritten to a zero even though that was the wrong score. More interestingly, when I checked the file in Safari, the grade for that score was updated to zero which means that the activity is reporting a "0" to the gradebook when taken in Firefox, specifically. Now, currently I haven't checked what happens in IE but I should also not that both Firefox and Safari were on Mac 10.5.6. Anyone know how to fix this issue with Firefox? I've never heard of Firefox glitching before Safari or IE. Creating the quizzes in Moodle isn't the route we want to take. We are looking to keep the quizzes in Captivate.

Post title: scorm html5 and mobile
Post description: Hello, I have an issue about tracking scorm objects on mobile. I have read many posts around without finding any solution. I made some contents using Articulate Storyline, I want them to be visible on mobile devices (iphone and ipad) and tracked in Moodle (2.6). Anyone can explain me if is possible and how to do? If I create "normal" scorm packages (even publishing from articulate with "html5 export" checked) and upload them in Moodle I can't see anything (scorm oblects load without end and nothing is show)... Later I succeed in VIEW contents (just upload content to web server and in Moodle I served links to story.html, for iphone, and launch_ios.html, for ipad ), but of course, as I didn't use scorm activity but only a simple link to an external file, I had not any kind of tracking of the contents. For ipad I think I understand the only way is to export to for articulate mobile application and use tin can api, thing that cut off Moodle as it doesn't have tincan api tracking (yet, I hope). But for html5? I think is correct to say that for mobile it's necessary to pick html5 file of the content (that, in fact is properly viewed by mobile device) but how to tell Moodle to take it when it is inside the zip file of scorm object? Articulate support say to serve contents on mobile by serving link to html... ok, but this means you can't track them or i'm wrong, as in Moodle you can't link to a specific file inside a zip? So, how to make Moodle track scorm objects on mobile devices? And, first of all, html5 support scorm tracking? Thank you and sorry for the bad english.

I realize that Moodle allows to me to limit the “Number of attempts” of using the Learning object in the setting for each Learning Object. The SCORM functions well, although I need to do some work on whether it is informing Moodle that it has been completed (any advice here, please?) but the generated certificate and associated input of user name has limitations.  I would therefore like to use the Moodle Certificate plugin, which, with modification, would print better and would take the user name from Moodle.  If this would work better with a Moodle quiz or lesson , I am happy to attempt this.  I need any transitions from the SCORM to a quiz (if required) and certificate to be as transparent to the student as possible - invisible would be good!  Because I am unfamiliar with Moodle, I am unsure about basic things, such as whether I should use a Course with SCORM Format, or include a SCORM Activity within a course.  I note that the Activity approach does not appear to allow a student the option to restart the SCORM as an alternative to Review Mode, but a Course with SCORM Format does, as well as working with the PayPal module, which I also need.  Any advice on any aspects of this would be very much appreciated. Sorry this is imprecise in its question - a reflection of my unfamiliarity!

Post title: replacing a scorm package when completion status required is enabled
Post description: When I try to replace (re- upload ) a new version of our scorm package, moodle throws a "error writing to database " error. Turning on php debug messages shows this: Debug info: Incorrect integer value: '' for column 'completionstatusrequired' at row 1 It's doing an update statement, in which I've identified the main problem - it's trying to insert an array as a single value... Here's the sql statement and it's matching parameters, in which i've highlighted the problematic fields. UPDATE mdl_scorm SET name = ?,scormtype = ?,updatefreq = ?,popup = ?,width = ?,height = ?,skipview = ?,hidebrowse = ?,displaycoursestructure = ?,hidetoc = ?,hidenav = ?,displayattemptstatus = ?,timeopen = ?,timeclose = ?,grademethod = ?,maxgrade = ?,maxattempt = ?,whatgrade = ?,forcenewattempt = ?,lastattemptlock = ?,forcecompleted = ?,auto = ?,launch = ?, completionstatusrequired = ? ,course = ?,intro = ?,introformat = ?,reference = ?,options = ?,timemodified = ? WHERE id=? [array ( 0 => 'Course Material', 1 => 'local', 2 => 0, 3 => '0', 4 => 100, 5 => 500, 6 => '2', 7 => '1', 8 => '0', 9 => '1', 10 => '1', The help associated with this item in the scorm package upload screen says: Checking one or more statuses will require a user to achieve at least one of the checked statuses in order to be marked complete in this SCORM activity, as well as any other Activity Completion requirements which confirms that I should be able to tick more than one status, however it's obvious that the field only accepts a single value. Is there a way to change the database to accept this value so that I don't have to keep turning off the completion status, then uploading, then re-enabling the settings?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Handling Multiple SCORM Quiz Attempts
Post description: We are using Moodle 2.7 and Storyline 2 for our SCORM authoring. What we want to achieve is the following: -- The student is presented a course that consists of two topics: 1) a SCORM-based quiz and 2) a certificate of completion. -- They can attempt the quiz no more than twice. -- If they pass it on one of their two attempts, the student can go to the next topic, which is the certificate of completion. -- If they fail both attempts, they do not get a certificate, and must instead take an entirely different course. We've tried to handle the limit of two attempts within the SCORM file by having the SCORM keep track of the number of failed attempts. If it is two, the SCORM does not allow the user to retry the quiz again. However, when the user exits the course after two failures and returns to it, they are dumped back into the course at the beginning of the quiz again. This isn't what we want. Instead, we'd like the user to be given a message about not being allowed to attempt the quiz again after failing twice. I'm beginning to wonder whether it would be better to handle the attempts within the SCORM or within Moodle.

Forum Post: 
Post title: SCORM Exit Activity v 2.33
Post description: I've been scanning many of the posts here and don't see anything like my question... I'm currently running 1.9 but am working on an upgrade to 2.4/2.5 (if it is released in time) and have noticed differences I'm not sure represent proper behavior. In general, I find the SCORM functionality much improved in 2.33, which is the version I'm testing but there are a couple things that don't scan for me.  I'll start by describing 1.9 behavior and then describe what 2.33 does with the same scenario. In 1.9, I set all my modules to open in a new window.  I click the activity and get a the summary and an Enter button.  When you click the Enter button on a SCORM Activity, it changes the page to one when recommends turning off a pop-up blocker if a window doesn't open and includes an Exit Activity link AND opens the SCORM in a new window.  I added some custom text to the pop-up blocker page to provide extra stuff my users need, particularly if they have blockers on.  Users know to click Exit Activity or the course shortname in the breadcrumbs to get back to the course navigation page when they close the SCORM window. In 2.33, I also set all my modules to open in a new window.  When I click the activity, it provides the activity summary and a participation summary (like this: Number of attempts allowed: Unlimited; Number of attempts you have made: 0, Grading method: Highest attempt, Grade reported: None) with the Enter button.  I click Enter, the summary page doesn't change and the SCORM opens.  When I complete the SCORM and close, I'm still on the introductory SCORM screen but it still says I have no attempts, a score of 0, etc.  And (other than the course main page breadcrumb) there is no way to get back to course navigation.  If I refresh the page, it updates the information (still now way back to course nav). That's fine for me, I get what's going on.  Not so much for less computer skilled users. Some of my users really struggle to understand the breadcrumbs philosophy and need alternate navigation.  These same users will be confused and upset because they believe the module is not reporting (even though it is) and I envision chaos and craziness for months to come (I'm not sure how that's different from my current state but maybe just different chaos and crazy).  I could add information to address the discrepancy, but many users don't actually read the directions and that may be of limited value. Is there something I need to set to change the behavior?  Is it different in 2.4/2.5?  Ideas?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Does SCORM allow branching scenarios?
Post description: I'm currently using Articulate to publish PowerPoint into flash/SCORM files. I have a large project that has some sophisticated requirements that are not possible with Articulate. I have a several-module course with between-module quizzes. Each quiz must be passed to advance to the next module. At the end of all of the modules there is a 20 question final assessment made up of questions from the different modules. A learner must earn at least 80 percent on the final assessment to complete the program. If a student scores 80 percent or better on the final assessment the course should be recognized as complete. If the student earns less than 80 percent, the student should be told how many were answered incorrectly and must be required to view the modules related to the questions that were missed. The modules in which the learner missed final assessment questions will be marked as incomplete and the student must fully complete these modules again before attempting another version of the final assessment. The student should only be required to re-take questions from the section in which they did not answer questions correctly. Learners do not need to be tested on the sections they have already completed successfully. The learner must retake the exam until a combined score of 80 percent is earned. For example, if the student answers 11 questions correctly and 9 incorrectly on the final assessment, he or she only needs to answer 5 of 9 questions correctly on the second version of the final assessment to demonstrate comprehension of the material. Learners will be allowed as many attempts as necessary to achieve an 80 percent score. Multiple versions of the final assessment will be used to pull new questions from the sections in which the student is answering questions incorrectly. Does SCORM permit this level of sophistication? If yes, do you know of any authoring tools that have these features? If SCORM is the limitation, rather than the authoring tool, can you recommend another route for me to solve this problem?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Open source API for SCORM 2004
Post description: Techniques.org has developed an API for SCORM 2004 and has released it as open source. It is the same they use in their LMS, wich is SCORM 2004 conformant. Perhaps it could help us to become SCORM 2004 conformant faster. It is 100% Javascript . You can get the API at: http://www.techniques.org/escorte4js/escorte4js.zip Some information about it: http://www.techniques.org/escorte4js/escorte4js.pdf Hope this helps.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Multiple Choice not reporting a result
Post description: I've been creating scorm objects using two different editors (Exe and CourseLab) and finding that when I build an assessment screen and use multiple choice questions (i.e. a radio button selection, allowing you to select one from a range of values) that these do not report to the gradebook at all. I am thinking that since it is multiple choice and the correct answer is revealed at the time of answering the question that somewhere along the line it is deemed unnecessary to report, but I am hoping to use the Certificate plug in which requires a DB value to be present. Both Exe and Courselab created Scorm objects behave the same way. I am not thinking this is a coincidence, but an intended behaviour that I don't know about. Either that, or I am misunderstanding how to set up the object! In Exe there is no fine control over the scoring, but in CourseLab there is. No matter which settings I use in the editor, nor what I put for the course in Moodle, I can't get a grade to show if all the questions are Multi-Choice. Any thoughts or pearls of wisdom gratefully received!

Post title: SCORM 3.3 and screen readers...
Post description: So, I'm testing a SCORM with a screen reader, which is a horrible thing.  Here are some things I'm seeing.  If I have the scorm open in the current window (which is preferred by my agency), the screen reader seems to have trouble reading the content--It wants to read everything but the package slides.  We're currently using Boost and I'm starting to hate the collapsible thing on the left that is supposed to replace blocks.  Even when minimized it wants to read all of it. So my real question...What are the best SCORM settings to use to get screen readers to read scorm content?  I know there is a lot of stuff I need to do inside my module (Captivate does NOT make it easy) but the settings and theme seem just as important.  Anyone else trying to make scorm accessibility compliant modules? Forum Post: 
Post title: Regression in latest stables preventing some teachers from updating/creating scorm
Post description: The security fix for MSA-24-0001 (Denial of service risk in file picker unzip functionality) which was included in 4.3.3, 4.2.6 and 4.1.9 now means that the "private files space" or userquota setting is now also used when a teacher tries to update a scorm package. Depending on what your debugging levels are set to, you may see errors like: " Exception - array_keys(): Argument #1 ($array) must be of type array, null given" Or entry to your updated SCORM package may just show an empty box instead of the SCORM package you are expecting. More information on this is here (and some of the related bugs) https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-81060 In the meantime, if you are affected by this bug, you may need to increase your private files limits for teachers so they can upload or update existing SCORM packages. Moodle's SCORM code basically only tries to unzip the package again if it sees the file is different from the one it already has - so if you have a teacher that has broken their SCORM activity due to this bug, you need to modify the scorm zip slightly (I added a text file called 0.txt to some packages I was fixing this week.) then get someone that doesn't have that userquota limit to upload the new scorm (or increase the userquota limit to get around it.)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Generating / inserting SCORM objects created by other Moodle components
Post description: Hello, I've written a little Flash-based applet to do on-screen jigsaw puzzles. This hooks up with a bit of PHP / Moodle server -based code that gets the original image off the (teacher) user, chops it up into several pieces, each in a new sperate image file, and shoves the whole lot in a Zip file. I'd like to add SCORM tracking facilities to the client-side part of this utility, then I could use SCORM to store state information about the jigsaw, i.e. use an XML string to store the position of each jigsaw piece so that the (pupil) user can leave off doing a jigsaw part-way through and come back to it later without having to completly restart. So, I've done SCORM-based stuff before, that's no problem, and it should be easy enough to add a few JavaScript files to the Zip file my utility generates and tada, I've got a SCORM-complient jigsaw utility. However, for a (teacher) user in Moodle to use this Zip file as a SCORM object in their course they'll have to download the generated Zip file, then create a new SCORM object in their course and upload that Zip file again. This is rather fiddly and introduces more steps than the average teacher has the patience for. What I would like is for my utility to be able to generate a SCORM-complient Zip archive, then have it insert this archive into a course as a SCORM object. Then, the (teacher) user just sees a nice two-or-three-step wizard type of interface where they add a picture, enter a few details, and their jigsaw appears as an object in their Moodle course. They don't even have to know it uses SCORM, there'll just a be a "Download a SCORM archive of this jigsaw" link on the setup page. One way for me to implement this would be to clone the existing SCORM module, adding a few bits to the setup form relevant to my jigsaw utility. This, however, seems rather a duff way of going about it - is there a more sensible way? --

Post title: SCORM grading question
Post description: Hi We're using Moodle 1.9, and are in the process of moving all our eLearning content from another LMS as SCORM activities in new Moodle topics-based courses. Most of my courses comprise a SCORM content module and a SCORM test. I want only the test score to be counted, so I set the grading method to 'learning objects' for the content module, and to 'highest score, unlimited attempts' for the test module. I do the test, and my score is properly tracked, but the course total isn't being completed. Since the test is the only part of the course that should have its score tracked, I don't know why this is happening - I must have an incorrect setting somewhere... Before we go live with moodle, I want our in-house registration system to be able to pull-out the Course Total amounts for our online moodle courses for reporting purposes, so I need the course total to be completed automatically when a learner finishes a scorm test. Can anyone help with settings, or point me to an online resource that can help? Thanks, Andy Dunn, Vancouver BC

Forum Post: 
Post title: RFC: SCORM Structure + Object Repositories + Best Practices
Post description: Hello everyone, I am adapting several pre-created lessons to SCORM compliant packages (via. Reload) for importing into an LMS such as moodle.  Although I have found lots of reference on how to accomplish individual aspects of the task, such as meta-data, javascript additions that are required, etc.  I am lacking a resource that can help me achieve an epiphany on the "bigger picture".  Considering the example.... 3 lessons each of which has it's own custom navigation and features to browse the varying page(s) of each lesson .  (i.e. lesson 1: All about widgets has 6 pages). Each lesson has several images, applets, etc. The goal is that all applets, and several of the more important images are to be search-able Assets for use by teachers in creating future content (whether it be in Moodle or some object repository). Although I can individually tag each asset properly, and create scorm compliant assets, I will eventually be dealing with approximately 500 of these lessons.  Here are some questions I have had turning over in my brain... if anyone out there has some experience in doing something similar to this, input would be greatly appreciated! 1. Should each Lesson be a SCO and will I add up to 500 lessons individually to Moodle then structure the course or should I create the "course" with individual lessons structured in reload? 2. A lot of my applets share common files, or images may be shared between lessons.  Is there a way to maintain that sharing, or will I need to create multiple copies of these common files to enforce the modularity of each lesson? 3. To implement the assets as their own search-able objects in an object repository (am i correct in thinking that moodle will implement a search-able OR for a not-so-distant release?), do I have to individually create each asset as it's own SCORM package, or can I simply tag assets with proper meta-data and will an O.R. be smart enough to do a subset search and return the proper files from the bigger package? 4. Not withstanding #3, if I was to tag an applet /image as a asset, is it customary to include a stub HTML page that is the main point of the asset so that the image (or more importantly) applet can be utilized properly?

Post title: Articulate Quizzes not always loading
Post description: Hello, Since we migrated a couple months ago to Moodle 2.8.6, we
regularly have students who say they were able to access quizzes built
with Quizmaker 09 but can't seem to be able to go back to them the next day, I have been playing with the settings but can't seem to
identify what fixes the issue. Would anyone be able to assist me? Some of the comments from students: "I was in the middle of  a quiz and was automatically knocked out of
it. None of the quizzes will now load on my PC." "I cannot open the Jura Review Quiz  although there was no problem before" "I tried review quiz 1,2,3,5 and none of them came up as they have done before" Articulate support staff looked at the quiz files and settings in Moodle, can re-create the issue with the accounts of those users, but say: " I am able to view Languedoc-Roussillon Review Quiz Bis
but not Provence Review Quiz using Felix's account. While, I am able to view
Provence Review Quiz but not able to view Languedoc-Roussillon Review Quiz Bis
using Michal's account. I have used both Google Chrome and Firefox to view the
course and seeing the same behavior. With this, I am not seeing any issues with Quizmaker
content since not all of the users were affected. I would recommend to raise
this concern to your LMS provider (Moodle) and let them know the results of our
testing. They might need to check the user accounts of the affected learners of
what might causing them not to view the quizzes." Julien

Forum Post: 
Post title: Admin settings - "Enable SCORM 1.2 standard mode" definite meaning
Post description: Hi all, As many of you know, there are some known bugs with SCORM. I was looking to overcome issues such as SCORM internet connection breaks, resume behaviour errors, and incomplete retrieved tracking data to name a few by altering configurations. It is my belief that the authoring tool we use - in cases where the courses built and compiled to SCORM contain a lot of data; potentially exceed the threshold of the suspend_data field... which may therefor be a cause of issues users have reported for example the "resume behaviour error" where the user would return to the course at a different point to where they had left off. So to the point of the discussion, I've come across this admin setting "Enable SCORM 1.2 standard mode"... @Site administration > Plugins > Activity modules > learning module. Where it enabled by default (ticked), it states the following.. " Disabling this setting allows Moodle to store more data than the SCORM 1.2 specification allows. If your SCORM packages allow users to enter large amounts of text or if your package tries to store large amounts of data in the suspend_data field disable this." In the Moodle SCORM 2.7 documentation is expands with: " If this setting is disabled, then it will be possible to exceed the allowed amount of stored data for SCORM 1.2 packages. Many SCORM packages go over the 4096 characters limit and while SCORM 2004 allows a higher number of characters, it is not supported. This setting will mean users can allow their 1.2 packages to store more data." Am I correct in saying my Moodle 2.7 site, where I run only SCORM 1.2 packages, that it would be wise to untick the box and (therefore would disable it?)? This has been a controversial topic at my workplace, as a specialist of Moodle advised us to keep it ticked (enabled) as "It only applies to SCORM 2004". Many thanks, Alex

Post title: Articulate Quiz freezing on submitting results
Post description: Hello, I am hoping to find help here as Articulate says my issue is a moodle issue, not an Articulate one. I initially posted on this forum thread on Articulate's website. Was on Moodle 3.0 and just upgraded to 3.1 hoping the following problem would get fixed with a moodle upgrade. Without success. The problem: Posting several 20-question quizzes made with Articulate Quizmaker 13,
publishing in Scorm 1.2. Our new quizzes contain pictures on the slide
masters (without the pictures, the problem seems not to happen). Once the last question of a quiz is answered, the
quiz seems to freeze (on the result slide for the question, after clicking contine) for about 20-30 seconds. Then, the question result slide goes away and it goes back to the last question instead of showing the full quiz result slide (which has the button to review the quiz)... nothing
happens if you click on submit... but if you use the "question list" to
go back a few questions and hit next to get to the last question, then
the quiz result slide comes up... If I cut the quiz to be much shorter (like 3-4 questions), there is a little freeze but we do get to the quiz result slide as expected. I have the latest Adobe Flash player on my PC. Tried with Firefox and Chrome. Same issue. Articulate tested one of our quizzes on Scorm Cloud. It works like a charm there. I really hope someone can help. We have quite a few frustrated students waiting for us to fix this bug! Thanks a lot! Julien

Forum Post: 
Post title: Sometimes no elements in xxx_scorm_scoes_track are populated except x.start.time
Post description: Hi, We have a transient issue with SCORM 1.2 and Moodle 2.x. On some occasions, but not always, in the DB, table xxx_scorm_scoes_track, the only element that is stored for the attempt is x.start.time. The effects of this inconsistency are the following: 1. When the user returns to the activity, nothing is stored anymore 2. When the user creates a new attempt, this is allowed, but only data pertinent to that new attempt are stored (the attempt records are overwritten) We also tried to "repair" the DB by eliminating attempts with too few elements stored, but this does not solve properly the problem, especially when there were created another attempt. Anyway, the root cause is that originally no elements were stored except x.start.time. Apparently, the problem is on the client side ( JavaScript ). We tried to track down outgoing requests via tcpdump and have found that sometimes they are silently lost on the client side instead of being sent to the server . Apparently, the issue is more probable to occur having bad network connection. The issue applies to any kind of course generated by Articulate as well as to custom-made material produced by using a SCORM wrapper. Our server platform is Centos 5.6 with PHP 5.2.x and MySQL 5.0. Can anyone help us out please?

Post title: Grading Method (SCORM)
Post description: We created a SCORM file using iSpring and uploaded it in moodle. The problem is that we are not getting the grade computation we are expecting. The composition of the SCORM is that it has 6 " check for understanding " questions scattered throughout the activity and at the end of the package is the actual quiz. In iSpring, we already set the CFUs to have zero points and have set the scoring type to none. We tested the course in moodle with both Highest Grade and Sum Grade as the grading method. But it looks like both are providing an average of all activities . I don't know if this will make sense but each CFU is being graded 100 by moodle. Multiplied by 6 = 600. For the last quiz, it has 5 questions with 20 points each. I attached two files here and you will see that the score generated is 97.14 and because they got 1 incorrect answer on one of the questions so they only got 80 points for that activity. So 600 + 80 = 680, to be divided by 7 because of 7 "learning activities " that's where moodle got the 97.14 score/grade. So the question is, what should be the setting we should select so it should show and calculate only the score for the last quiz? Do I have to do it in iSpring or it should be done in moodle?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle not recording SCORM (2004) interactions
Post description: Moodle 3.11.3; SCORM 2004; Storyline 360 (latest). The situation can arise where Moodle does not log the interactions from the SCORM package. On real courses this can result in a learner passing the course but that not being recorded on the LMS. We have tracked instances where learners have provided evidence of passing the course (screenshot of success slide) but neither the final scores nor status was recorded in Moodle - 1st attempt score were and in some cases part of the 2nd attempt is recorded too. The issue seems to only occur if the assessment is not passed on 1st attempt. SCORM is setup to allow 2 attempts. I created a simple test quiz in Storyline 360, based on a real assessment but with fewer questions. I enabled API debugging. The API debug consistently shows all the interactions (answers) being recorded but Moodle interactions report (and user activity logs) don't. For example, failing the assessment twice, closing the module, refreshing the page and going back in from the start may result in only some or none of the answers being recorded in Moodle, despite the API debug activity logs showing them all. In this situation, the server access logs also confirm that there's no posting of the SCORM data but there are periodic calls (30 seconds) to POST /lib/ ajax /service.php?sesskey=[session]&info=core_session_touch HTTP/1.0. So something is still happening. Nothing obvious in the browser console. Anyone have any clues why this can happen and more importantly, what can be done to fix it? P.S. This seems to be similar to this but that topic is locked without a clear resolution: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=417245

Post title: Return from SCORM to the main 'topic outline'
Post description: Hi, I've got a question about using a SCORM package in Moodle and I wonder if someone could advise what the best solution would be. I've uploaded a SCORM package to Moodle. From the Topics Outline view (the main course view) I click on my SCORM package link. It takes me to a new Moodle screen where I can have a text description of the course and there is an "Enter" button at the bottom. Click the Enter button and the SCORM package opens in a completely new separate window. When you have finished the SCORM course or if you close the window, you are returned to Moodle. The Moodle screen you are returned to just has the name of the SCORM package to the left. The rest of the screen is blank. There are no obvious buttons to return you to the Topics Outline (the logical place you'd expect to be returned to). The only way to get back gracefully seems to be to click on the breadcrumbs. Realistically it is likely a user will either click the Back button on the browser or they will close the Moodle window thinking that the Topics Outline window will be behind it. Of course it isn't and they will have to restart Moodle - rather annoying! After starting the SCORM package, on returning from it to Moodle, how can the user be returned directly to the Topics Outline page? Any help would be appreciated as it's currently not very user friendly. Michael

Forum Post: 
Post title: Mobile Moodle & SCORM
Post description: Hi Moodle Community, I'm looking for use cases where organizations or vendors have implemented SCORM as part of the mobile learning strategy. If you have a use case please contact me. I'm interested in real success stories and I would like to add you to the list. If you are using SCORM, I could send a few questions if you are interested or set up a time to chat. We will be sharing the results of this research and I will also briefly cover this during my session at the upcoming mLearnCon event ( http://www.mlearncon.com ). So far I have already heard of several use cases where organizations are using SCORM as part of their mobile learning initiative. I'm interested in mobile learning as part of either training or performance-support scenarios. I'm also interested in hearing from mobile vendors about their technical approach to their SCORM implementation. I'm tracking this and communicating with the community on twitter using the hashtag #MobileSCORM ( http://www.twapperkeeper.com/hashtag/MobileSCORM ). Please contact me if you know of a mobile application or mobile learning situation that supports SCORM. I would love to hear from you! +1-850-266-7100 Email: jason.haag.ctr@adlnet[dot]gov

Post title: repository for reusable and easily updated SCORM files
Post description: Hi all, My goal is to have all the SCORM files in the file picker and have single course template with elearning activities that are always up to date when I replace some of SCORM content with a newer version.  I will import activities from that template to other courses. I am working for a company where we do multiple similar courses. Many courses uses the same SCORM files. One group of people prepare SCORM content and another group manages moodle. We run moodle 4.3 at the moment. As a moodle administrator I am trying to make my life easier on the moodle side and suggested we create a repository to store all our elearnings. I was hoping I could save server space and update elearning activities easily. I have a template course with all the existing elearning activities and use import to course function when making a new course and hand pick the ones I need. So far I tried "file system repository" with alias pointing to scorm's ...manifest. xml file and it somewhat worked, I had to go the elearning activity settings, open the file manager, click big blue update button it did update. Automatic update setting didn't work at all. So this setup is somewhat working, but my issue is that we use docker image on server and currently I have no idea how to set up this properly and people who prepares and updates scorm files won't be happy to have to setup another software and access FTP directly to upload elearnings. Also it seems we would have to keep scorms files extracted, as update button doesn't seem to work with zip files. I left that idea mostly because of FTP. Then I tried to create oneDrive and Microsoft 365 repositories. I faced another issue. It is that microsoft account connected to my moodle account cannot access files that are shared with me. I can see my private files in the file picker, but I cannot see the elearnings directory which is being managed on sharepoint service. Neither onedrive or Microsoft 365 repositories allowed me to access them even I was given owner rights. That's why I mention that we have different teams working on different things so I am fairly limited in what content my account owns and what is shared.

Forum Post: 
Post title: SCORM authoring tools with annotation tool
Post description: Hello everyone, We recently had learners from one of the schools we manage use the Moodle app on their iPads. One essential feature they need is a way to annotate within the platform. While we can use plugins like Amanote on the web version of Moodle, the app doesn't support this since the learners only access it on their iPads to ensure they can work offline. Currently, we're using iSpring to host and upload our content, which includes some drawing tools for annotations. However, the annotations reset after each session, which isn't ideal. I've been looking for alternatives that would allow us to upload content while enabling persistent annotation but haven't found a suitable solution. Alternatively, if we upload content in PDF format, is there a way to prevent the PDFs from being downloaded? Also, is there a plugin compatible with the Moodle app that allows learners to annotate PDFs? I would greatly appreciate any suggestions you might have. Thank you!

Forum Post: 
Post title: SCORM Tracking Records orphaned
Post description: This issue is perhaps akin to the situation where SCORM tracking records are removed when the manifest IDs don't match. However, we have taken care to make sure the identifiers don't change when uploading a new version of the course.  In this case, when uploading an updated SCORM zip, all of the records in scorm_scoes_track get orphaned.  I believe this happens because the SCO IDs get updated in the scorm_scoes table, but the scoid field in the scorm_scoes_track records doesn't get updated. This results in a bunch of records in scorm_scoes_track that reference a scoid that no longer exists, which causes problems for reporting. Has anyone else seen this behavior?  It doesn't seem to happen every time we do an update, which is perplexing, because I have tried debugging through the code to determine if there might be a bug, but have come up empty. Could it be related to a timeout?

Forum Post: 
Post title: SCORM 1.2 student preference problems
Post description: Hello everyone, For those of you who have been unable to get certain scorm 1.2 values, well, you can now rest easy - I fixed the problem.  There's an open ticket on it right now, but this fixes these problems. This would apply if you were unable to get the following scorm values: cmi.student_preference.audio cmi.student_preference.language cmi.student_preference.speed cmi.student_preference.text The problem is simply because in the scorm_12.js file, these values were set with empty default values. The fix simply replaces the empty default value with the value from the database . I've tested it extensively with a LMS test prodder and the values are now being returned properly. You can get the updated file by clicking here ... Unzip the file and drop it in the mode/scorm/datamodel directory and the problem should be fixed... caveat:  use at your own risk, of course. Kim

Post title: Cross domain scripting - Session timing out issue
Post description: We are developing a gateway application that will enable launching of course content from a Content Management System into different LMS with the help of SCORM APIs. We were able to do so with the LMS like BlackBoard, WebCT, WebCT Vista, Angel, Desire2Learn with the help of a proxy. But we are finding it difficult in Moodle 1.8.3. While recreating the SCORM course launch page, we create a popup window using the proxy; but it gets timed out and redirected to index.php asking the user to re-enter the credentials unlike other LMS where the user information is retained. There are three cookies being set namely MOODLEID_, MoodleSession, MoodleSessionTest. We use these cookies for overcoming the cross domain scripting issue by re-writing them in the browser of the proxy pop-up window. Even after setting all the cookies properly, we obtain the same "Session Timed-out" error which leads to the SESSION value being set to null. Kindly provide a solution to resolve this issue. I would also like to clarify whether this approach will enable us to integrate the Moodle CMS with our gateway application. Since we were able to integrate other LMS as mentioned above. Many thanks in advance.

Forum Post: 
Post title: cmi.core.lesson_status on second entry to sco
Post description: Hi All, I'm authoring a 3-sco scorm 1.2 package using Flash CS3. I'm only setting one cmi.core value, cmi.core.lesson_status. I set it to "incomplete" when the first frame of the swf loads, and to "completed" when the last frame of the swf loads. I'm doing this by importing flash.external.ExternalInterface into Flash, importing APIWrapper.js (from ADL) into the HTML page which contains the swf embed. The setting of the values works great. If I enter a sco, then leave it, lesson_status is set to "incomplete". If I go all the way to the end, lesson_status is set to "completed". The problem is that every time I enter the sco, the old value is erased by the new. So if I've completed the sco already, and I enter and do not finish it a second time, the sco lesson_status is reset to "incomplete"! I've looked at the scoring settings for the Moodle scorm activity, and changed them around quite a bit, and it doesn't seem to make any difference. Perhaps what's needed is a revision to the function in APIWrapper.js so that it only changes lesson_status to "incomplete" if it isn't already set. I'll see if I can write some JS to make that happen. But if anyone out there has already had to think through this, or has any bright ideas, I'd sure appreciate suggestions. Humbly, Amy

I have written JavaScript that works in the SCORM Cloud for all browsers and most recent versions. After one completed lesson it should automatically jump forward to the next lesson, but if one lesson is incomplete, the user should be able to start at the same point in the next session. My Problem is: After a completed lesson, the next lesson doesn't start automatically and the user has to choose it manually from the navigation-bar next to the Application-Window. Another problem is, that bookmarks are just set when the user is in the last lesson of the test. If the user is in a previous lesson, the test starts in the next lesson on a new session. Those problems still exist, when i check the configurations, which force the test to continue automatically. Do i have to set some other configurations in captivate or moodle? Thanks for your reply.

Post title: SCORM Objectives- simple questions
Post description: Hello- I have some simple questions regarding the SCORM module: Does the current SCORM module (1.6+) support multiple objectives per SCO (i.e. cmi.objectives. n .score.scaled, ...success_status, etc.)? Does it support "global" objectives, i.e. the use of the "mapInfo" tag in the imsmanifest. xml ? I have searched the forums and all documentation, and I haven't been able to find a definitive answer. I have been working with a simple SCO that has several objectives defined within the manifest, however when I try a simple GetValue("cmi.objectives._count") the value returned is zero. I am afraid this means that objectives are not supported in the current version of Moodle (by the way, this same SCORM package works in the ADL's Sample RTE). Is there a setting within Moodle that I have to turn on? Is there a newer version in development that contains support for objectives? Am I just doing something stupid? Any and all guidance would be appreciated. I've attached my small imsmanifest.xml file if that helps. Chris

Forum Post: 
Post title: SCORM HTML5 Course Crashing/Timeout
Post description: We have recently migrated from using Flash to HTML5 scorm courses. All of the courses have not had issues except for one. This particular course is about 90 questions long, each question having an associated question pool. When a user tries to take the test, it initially load fine, but it eventually chokes up when loading the next question. The browser displays a 503 http error (service unavailable) when this happens and it can not finish loading the page. At this point, the user is forced to close the window that the course is in and they have to re-login into Moodle. My hunch is that the cause for this is that HTML5 breaks up the data transfer between Moodle and the Scorm course into individual HTTP requests. Due to the amount of data Scorm is trying to exchange, it hits some kind of limit in either PHP or IIS that restarts the current session / application pool (which is why the user gets logged off) Interested if anyone has had a similar experience or if anyone has suggestions on how to limit scorm requests. Other info:   Moodle version 3.1+ on IIS hosted on a dedicated Windows server with plenty of resources.

Post description: I'm farily new to Moodle and have been working on a VERY annoying issue for over a week. I have searched numerous forums and can't really locate an answer to my problem, possibly because I may not understand what the problem really is. We have had a successful Moodle installation running for about 6 months as a test for course distribution in SCORM format. Up until sometime in the recent past, everything was working fine - everyone involed was thrilled. At some point in the last 1-2 months, everyting went awry and now no courses will actually load... unless you uninstall the Adobe Flash Player COMPLETELY from your system and use an HTML5 Highly compliant browser (Like Safari), in which case everything is still beautiful. The best I can figure is that some update from Adobe of the last several months has introduced an issue that allows the initial load of the framework of a course, but the course just sits and spins eternally from that point forward. We have re-exported, updated Moodle to 2.4.1, and updated the course production software (Articulate Storyline), played with every export option we can think of and have pretty much destroyed the world and completely rebuilt everything. Nothing works. The only thing I wish could happen, but that our hosting will not allow, is a full server reboot. So, anyone else ever see this issue? It's platform and system wide (Win, Mac, Explorer, Safari, Chrome, Firefox , etc.) We're at a total loss. Thanks in advance to anyone that has a clue what might be happening.

Post description: Problem While we were using 2.3 we were dabbling in using the "External AICC URL " and were happy with the results. Content from Kenexa's LCMS 8.2 would be available, using a URL generated using an AICC Export generator, in Moodle 2.3.x. It took a bit of work to sort everything out as there wasn't a lot of documentation available from Kenexa on how to use the AICC Export tools. Now we've upgraded to Moodle 2.5.2 and we're running into some issues that prevent us from creating any new activities that include External AICC URLs. All existing activities that include them work fine. The content loads, the grades are recorded, etc. Details This is the "publish. xml " file that the LCMS uses to create the AICC URL and Export: <publish_configuration> <destination> <id>02</id> <label>Moodle</label> <url>http:// domain /moodle</url> <standard>pens</standard> <transport_location>http://domain/subdomain/evsfiles/exports</transport_location> <transport_userid></transport_userid> <transport_account>yyyyyyy</transport_account> <transport_password>yyyyyyy</transport_password> <system_userid>xxxxxx</system_userid> <system_password>xxxxxx</system_password> </destination> This file hasn't changed any since we got it working the first time, and worked until Moodle was upgraded. Forum Post: 
Post title: Exit Title/Close Window button in Lectora.. does nothing in Moodle?
Post description: Hi all, we build our SCORM packages for Moodle using Lectora, and have always added, but hidden the Exit Title/Close Window button that is typically required. If we didn't have it in, we would get the message "You must have an "Exit Title" Action somewhere in an assignable unit for AICC compliance." We had hidden it as it did not actually close the package though. We also set our SCORM packages to open in the same window. For now learners have to use the "Exit Activity" button to exit the SCORM package, but I am curious, why does the "Exit Title" button not do anything? I can include the button in the Lectora titile, and when I click it, the API calls to LMSFinish do work but the window is not closed. SCORM Debugging shows: Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSSetValue("cmi.core.session_time", "00:00:10") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: Commit("", "") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSCommit("AJAXResult", "true") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSCommit("result", "true") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSCommit("errorCode", "0") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSFinish("AJAXResult", "true") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSFinish("result", "true") => 0 scoid = 10933 Mon, 26 Oct 2015 19:53:47 GMT: LMSFinish("", "") => 0 scoid = 10933 If I upload the same SCORM zip file to the Scorm Cloud, clicking the button closes the window properly. Even when I set the SCORM package to open in a new window in Moodle, the close title button does not close the SCORM package window. Was this a delibrate design decision? We would love to have a way for the learner to click the close button in the module itself and "Exit Title/Close Windows" seems to be the thing that was designed for it. It does also seem possible, as I have seen another Moodle instance that uses Storyline SCORM packages, hides the exit activity button and when the person clicks the "Finish" button in the SCORM package itself, it takes them back to the course page.

Forum Post: 
Post title: LMSSetValue Error and Lectora
Post description: Hi everyone, Quite stuck with an issue I'm having with Lectora 12 and Moodle 2.2. I have built a course (small - 4 MCQs and 4 short answers). The course has 2 chapters - a PC chapter, and a mobile chapter (which is a duplicate of the PC chapter, but mobile-sized). Both chapters share the same variables and retaining answers is on in the aim that users can switch between the mobile and PC versions and it will track where they are up to. On a PC, variables are retained, it can remember where the user is up to, no errors. If part way through the course I switch to my iphone and try to pick up where I left off, it can see where I got up to, and works. BUT, if I go out of the mobile version from there, and back in again, it has lost all the completed questions and it throws the following error: LMSSetValue Error: Some of the persistent data was not able to be stored. To make it even weirder, if I go back to the PC version, it's remembered where I got up to (but on the PC version, not the mobile version) and doesn't throw any errors. I have tried this fix that I saw floating around: CMIString4096 = '^[\\u0000-\\uffff]{0,40960}$'; which helped (as at first it was throwing the persistent data error on mobile ALL the time, not just the second time), but hasn't entirely fixed the problem. I've tried both SCORM 1.2 and 2004 and it doesn't seem to make a difference. Any ideas?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Scorm in Greek -
Post description: We are loading some Greek language scorms into Moodle 1.5.4. The actual pages are fine, but the course contents come out in characters that are not Greek.  They were encoded as UTF8.  When we change the encoding in the browser to UTF8, the course contents look correct, but then all the Greek controls are not displayed properly, because they have been encoded with Greek Windows.  If we try to upload a scorm with Greek windows encoding, we get an error. The only way to get round this is to change the "thischarset" in the moodle.php file to UTF-8, and then replace every Greek term in the file with the UTF8 version.  As the only way we've found to do this is by copy and paste from Word into Notepad, this will take rather a long time. Has anyone else done this already, or is there another solution? Thanks Geoff Dische

Post title: SCORM multiple user overload
Post description: Hello, I am eLearning developer for a land-based college. We use moodle version 3.3.2+ (Build: 20170928) I have developed some eLearning resources for the college's induction period. They are SCORM packages developed in Articulate Storyline. They are not large modules - the largest is 45mb and they have been fully tested on desktops, tablets, phones etc. and function correctly as an individual user in moodle. We have started to experience serious issues when the student uptake has increased on these courses. This can happen with approx. 50 users. What usually happens is the courses start as they should and then 15-20 mins into the session they start to freeze. This is usually represented by the spinning flash loader. Some users get the '500 - internal server error'. Usually if they close the scorm package and re-open they can continue from where they left off. Does anyone have experience of this or possible fixes - please note my knowledge of servers is limited so please keep in layman's terms. Many thanks, Pete

Post title: Regular Expressions
Post description: I'm using moodle 1.6 and SCORM 1.2. When finishing a course I got a message "Invalid data format". I checked my SCORM course with ADL Test Suite without getting errors or warnings. Next, I debuged where the error comes from, it is cmi.interactions.n.id with the following data type: CMIIdentifier The format CMIIdentifier specifies a alpha-numeric string without internal spaces. Some of my id's have an hypher in it, that is not allowed in moodle. In another documentations it is declared as alpha-numeric string inclusive . and hypher without spaces. I think, that the regular expression for CMIIdentifier should be the following: CMIIdentifier = '^\\w[\\w|\\-]{1,255}$'; Could there anyone confirm that I am right?

Forum Post: 
Post title: A simple multiple HTML pages SCO in moodle
Post description: Hi Folks I am following the Click2Learn SCORM document which seems pretty comprehensive. In the 6 th Chapter there is an example of building a Multiple-Page SCO which I have cut and pate and checked line by line & which appears to me to be an extremely simple and robust example of attempting this kind of process. The Scormed course is attached as bib.zip. The document can be viewed ar www.icywater.com/learningpool/scotm2.pdf I scormed the course using Myles 1.2 scorm software which I am certain means that it is 100% 1.2 SCORMed. The document introduces this example with some instructive comments: "Nothing in the SCORM specification prohibits you from using more than one HTML file in a SCO, and from navigating from page to page within the SCO. Indeed, in many cases a single page just cannot adequately deliver the desired learning experience. "However, there is a basic problem with using multiple HTML pages to make up a SCO. As you go from page to page, no state information is retained. For example, if page1.html called LMSInitialize, when you went to page2.html nothing persisted to remember that LMSInitialize has already been called. Since the SCO must remember at least the state of the communication session with the API, a method must be devised to remember this information. If such a method exists, it also enables the SCO to keep track of other important information, like the status of learning objectives, or what the sequence of pages should be. "We will not consider here the case where you would change assets displayed within a standing HMTL page. There is no problem there since the page itself remains loaded." I have loaded this example to Moodle v1.8 and through the alerts in the code it appears that at the very first attempt for the code to reference the API from within the SCO the system returns that the API is null … and as far as I can see there is absolutely no communication between the course & the LMS because of this failure at the very first attempt to communicate with the LMS. However, I also notice that if I press F5 on the moodle page the course was launched from I can see that moodle thinks that the course has been partially-viewed. For this to be recorded does this mean that the Initialization of this SCO could have been done within moodle so that when the courses main html page tried to find the API it fails because the SCO was initilaised already through moodle? This does not appear to be happening in moodle version 1.5 ... Does any of this sound likely?  At this stade I'm beginning to doubt my own eyes ... Cheers Alan

Forum Post: 
Post title: Unable to run our content
Post description: I am a developer for a software company that creates E-Learning products. One of those products is an authoring tool. The content created with the authoring tool is played through a .NET Rich Client Object. Basically, this is a dll that is referenced on a web page via an <OBJECT> tag. Much like activeX but not at all the same (the object syntax is very different). .NET Rich Client Objects will only ever run on a web page using an HTTP path, they will simply not load if the path is a UNC (this is done for security reasons). And here lies my problem. I am able to upload and import our SCORM packages without any problems in Moodle however, when I attempt to launch the content it all goes wrong because IE will not load the player object. If I move the content into the htdocs area of the Apache server and launch the content via a direct URL it runs fine. From what I can gather, the problem lies with the whole ‘file.php – send_file – readfile_chunked’ mechanism being used by Moodle. I get the impression that the data written back to the browser as a result of the readfile_chunked routine is interpreted by IE as being a file path rather than a valid HTTP path and so therefore refuses to render my player. My question is this: is there a way of A. Forcing Moodle to place my content into a folder that can have an http path to it and B. Force Moodle to launch my content based on the path sent in the imsmanifest file rather than via the file.php method? Any help you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Storyline SCORM 1.2 SCOs Exit Course/LMSFinish Issue in Linux Moodle 2.4
Post description: I am having an issue with Storyline SCORM 1.2 SCOs that were working fine in a Moodle 2.2 Windows implementation, but are now hitting a problem in a Moodle 2.4 installation on Linux. In doing some debugging work, I think I've identified where the issue is occurring and how it differs from the Windows installation. The issue occurs only when clicking the "Next" button in our course, where we have attached an "Exit Course" trigger. In the Storyline SCO debug window, a sequence of SCORM functions are called. The sequence looks like this: 1159: - In SCORM_Finish strExitType=SUSPEND, blnStatusWasSet=true 1160: - In SCORM_ClearErrorInfo 1161: - Setting Exit 1162: - In SCORM_TranslatgeExitTypeToSCORM strExitType-SUSPEND 1163: - Returning suspend 1164: - SCORM_CallLMSSetValue strElement=cmi.core.exit, strValue=suspend 1165: - In SCORM_GrabAPI 1166: - SCORM_GrabAPI, returning 1167: - Calling LMSSetValue 1168: - strResult=true 1169: - Returning true 1170: - Calling Commit 1171: - In SCORM_CallLMSCommit Now here is where the problem begins. In Windows Moodle 2.2, after calling LMSFinish, you see the following: strResult=true Returning True Returning True These lines are missing in Linux Moodle 2.2, which stem from the function SCORM_CallLMSFinish() defined in SCORMFunctions.js in the /lms folder in the published package. By looking at the API Debug window in Moodle, I see that LMSFinish is called, and then the API object shuts down. So the line "strResult = SCORM_objAPI.LMSFinish("");" from SCORM_CallLMSFinish() does not execute, since no API object exists. So even though I click "Next", which executes the "Exit Course" trigger, the Storyline content just stays as is. When I click the "Next" button AGAIN, I see the "Goodbye.html" file displayed, more functions execute in the debug window, but there is still no API object. So I can then exit the SCO by clicking on the link provided in the Moodle Interface, which brings me back to the course menu. But when I try to re-enter the SCO, it just hangs (I assume because it did not shut down properly. Everything else seems to be working fine (Quizzes passing values, suspend data, completion of the SCO, etc.), but there is some issue with the "Exit Course/LMSFinish" functions in the SCO.  I tested the SCO on the ADL Test Suite 1.2.7. Any advice on how to proceed would be appreciated. I am wondering if some of the functions within the Exit Course sequence of events in the SCO could be moved up so this shutdown of the API object does not cause a problem.  Not sure if this is a fix that should be implemented on the Moodle/Mod/SCORM side or the Storyline side. I have a sample SCO that illustrates the problem at http://www.isodynamic.com/clients/moodle/Test_SCO_v01.zip .  Pasted below is the SCORM API Activity Log from this sample SCO. Thanks! cmi.interactions_1.student_response We_can_build_our_strategy_and_impact_the_culture_of_our_organisation_through_this_programme 


```text
cmi.interactions_1.time 19:11:57
```
 Using that info I can work out that the student did answer all the questions in the attempt and he should have received a valid grade. However the "General data" section in that "Track details" page (/mod/scorm/report.php) shows the 'Raw score', 'Min score' and 'Max score' fields as blank. And the 'Status' is 'Incomplete". Example: Track details General data Element Value Raw
score Min
score Max
score Status Incomplete Time 2
hours 30 minutes 40.39 seconds The 'Time' is "2 hours 30 minutes 40.39 seconds", so from this data I can clearly see that the student did complete the activity. But I'm unable to determine why Moodle gave the attempt a grade of 0 (when most of the student responses were actually correct). Lots of other students have successfully completed the activity without experiencing this problem. The simplest thing is to do a manual grade override in the gradebook to give the student the credit, but that's the last resort. Instead, is there some way to "regrade" that SCORM attempt? In other words, is there some way that I can recover the scorm attempt by getting the scorm module to re-calculate the result again and push it to the gradebook? In the Quiz module I would simply "regrade" the quiz attempt. Is there a way to "regrade" a scorm activity attempt? Thanks

Forum Post: 
Post title: deleting records in mdl_scorm_scoes in 1.96
Post description: We have recently noticed a change we don’t understand in our SCORM module. If an admin is in course/modedit.php to update an existing SCO the system appears to delete all records in mdl_scorm_scoes for the existing SCO and creates a new set of records plus it changes the scoid value for all existing records in mdl_scorm_scoes_track from the old values to the values for the new mdl_scorm_scoes records. We compare this with an older version of the SCORM module where the system merely updates values in the existing record in mdl_scorm_scoes only. Perhaps we are missing something but we think that the older method is a better approach so in our version of the SCORM 1.96 module we have changed in mod/scorm/datamodels/scormlib.php from the current code: // Insert the new SCO, and retain the link between the old and new for later adjustment $id = insert_record('scorm_scoes',$newitem); if (!empty($olditems) && ($olditemid = scorm_array_search('identifier',$newitem->identifier,$olditems))) { $olditems[$olditemid]->newid = $id; } To the earlier version of this activity: $id = 0; if (!empty($olditems) && ($olditemid = scorm_array_search('identifier',$newitem->identifier,$olditems))) { $newitem->id = $olditemid; $id = update_record('scorm_scoes',$newitem); unset($olditems[$olditemid]); delete_records('scorm_scoes_data','scoid',$olditemid); } else { $id = insert_record('scorm_scoes',$newitem); } We are interested to know if we are missing something here and whether there is a reason why the incrementing of the scoe number in each update is done deliberately in SCORM 1.96 to achieve something that we can’t quite grasp. If not we would like to share our ‘fix’ to this issue with the community … and ask what the implications may be for SCORM 1.9.8. Many thanks Jon ( Edited by Dan Marsden removed Word formatting- original submission Tuesday, 6 April 2010, 10:44 PM )

Forum Post: 
Post title: Arguments For Flash Files
Post description: First off - bringing SCORM support to Moodle is a nice piece of work and I've no doubt it will benefit Moodle and all its users without end. I run the website, http://www.xquestion.com , which allows users to convert tests and assessments from QTI (Question and Test Interoperability Specification) directly into SCORM modules. I downloaded the 1.2.1 release and added the SCORM module to see how XQuestion output would run in Moodle. The sample SCORM package is available at http://www.xquestion.com/Examples.html I successfully imported the package, but there were other problems. I tracked them down on the server and following problem occurs. The following file is requested, /moodle/file.php/2/moddata/scorm/SCORMKD4kYcp8/test.swf?forwardURL=finish.html%3FSCORE%3D%24que_score%24%26MINSCORE%3D0.0%26MAXSCORE%3D100.0 and, while the test.swf is present in the correct location, it is returning Sorry, but the file you are looking for was not found (/home/clans/moodledata/2/moddata/scorm/SCORMKD4kYcp8/test.swf?forwardURL=finish.html?SCORE=$que_score$&MINSCORE=0.0&MAXSCORE=100.0) I think that file.php is not allowing for the fact that files can be called with arguments in this way and is looking to match the whole string rather than the portion before the '?'. This is often the case with flash files, but can be true also of .html files ( javascript can access these variables). I don't think this is related to the problem that has been discussed here regarding Apache 2 and replacing the ? with / - that's not a problem (I'm using Apache 1) and it is serving other files from within the package okay - just not the flash file with arguments. Anyway, i've done a little perl and php and would be happy to lend a hand to do a fix if it is agreed that this is the problem. I'd like to be supportive of Moodle efforts to add SCORM and I'll keep an eye on this forum to help with any SCORM issues.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Recommended file SCORM file size
Post description: Hi Community, Is there a recommended or maximum file size for SCORMs to help ensure optimal performance? I'm in the midst of creating a course in Storyline that will be audio and video rich and so the published SCORM file size will probably exceed 40KB. I just want to know if it's likely to be a bit sluggish when used? Thanks in advance!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It depends a bit on how the module loads the content and your learner's connection speeds. We use Lectora and it loads resources when the person goes to each page, so while they may need a few seconds for a large activity or video to load when they navigate to the next screen, the module itself loads quickly. We have modules that are 100MB+ and have no complaints. You can use the developer tools in a browser to simulate slower network speeds. Example here for Google Chrome: https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/network , with the "Simulate a slower network connection" info here: https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/network#throttle I tend to test with "Fast 3G" as a baseline to see how painful a cell phone connection will be. "Slow 3G" May be applicable to you also depending on how fast you expect your learner's connection speeds to be.
Comment 2: Hi Mathew, Thanks for your response. It's great to know that you've had SCORMS that are far bigger than ours that work fine so I expect we'll be OK. I didn't know about simulating slower network connections in browsers so thanks for the useful tip! Tom
Comment 3: At my old job, we had scorms that were 700+ MB and they ran fine. They were so big, we couldn't actually load them, they had to be FTP 'd to the system. No problems (other than they were old and would only run on IE ...and then only IE 9 or lower).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Issue with scorm 2004 and  launch_data variable
Post description: Hi, Our studio created a scorm package, in the manifest xml file there is a tag called adlcp:dataFromLMS. the scorm version is 2004. When I open the activity the return value of launch data is empty and the activity can't be open. In moodle scorm 1.2 it works fine. Someone have any idea? Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Moodle doesn't provide complete support for SCORM 2004 - see here for more details: https://danmarsden.com/blog/2013/05/06/stopping-work-on-scorm-2004/ in Moodle SCORM 2004 code cmi.launch_data is initialized when entering the SCORM with the data from cmi.exit (instead of dataFromLMS) - I'm not sure if that is a bug or correct 2004 behaviour and something else is causing your package to fail. If you have funding available to help pay for someone's time to diagnose this further feel free to get in touch, otherwise you need to stick to using SCORM 1.2 packages.
Comment 2: I made some changes to scorm_13.js and scorm_13lib.php both in mod/scorm/datamodels (modified versions attached) This solves our problems. Maybe someone could test these and line them up to be included in a next version?
Comment 3: Great to hear you have it sorted for your use. Here are the conditions required to allow a SCORM 2004 related patch to land in the core code. Issues related to the 2004 specification will be closed as "won't fix" unless the following conditions are met. A patch is provided by someone in the community that fixes this issue. The patch meets Moodle's coding guidelines. full testing instructions are provided that allows the issue to be tested correctly. Unit tests (where possible) have been implemented. The patch can be attributed directly to a SCORM 2004 ADL test that now passes with the patch (if the patch is related to running the SCORM package) Screenshots of the SCORM 2004 ADL test being completed with the patch. If funding is provided to pay for the time of the SCORM maintainer to review/test/develop some of the above are not fixed requirements. (I maintain SCORM as a volunteer.) thanks!
Comment 4: I have attached a patch for this. It will work for Moodle 2.8 and 2.9. I'll leave it up to others to test and do whatever else is necessary.
